column4: is there a way to tell apt-get to download the unmet dependencies? I tried apt-get install apache2, and I get the following unmet dependencies: apache2-mpm-worker, apache2-mpm-prefork and apache2-mpm-prechild. Fine, but now I found that apache2-mpm-prefork has other unmet dependencies. Is there a way apt-get would just get all the dependencies automatically?
well, before that I got the repository list form ubuntuguide.org
do you think that's where I screw it LjL?
get rid of the sources.list you got from ubuntuguide and use the one for your system (and hope you haven't botched up anything important)
I did apt-get update and also apt-get upgrade, but I think both failed
0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
ubuntu_noob yes, when the process is finished
are you any good with a terminal only?
I think I could be better, but I like the terminal only
good. try "sudo apt-get install --reinstall ubuntu-desktop" using your new sources.list (you may lose gnome during this, which is why i asked about your terminal skills)
I go this: Reinstallation of ubuntu-desktop is not possible, it cannot be downloaded.
all I want is to run apache, php, and drupal :-/
as long as you have those non ubuntu packages installed, you will have lots of problems
would you say it's easier to install again? (I can do that if needed and if it's faster()
if you have no data to lose, go ahead. just dont visit the ubuntuguide this time, come here instead
